content:
Task 28-25-00-810-814-A

Refuel (Act 2) - Fails To Refuel In Manual Control - (20170501)

Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999
WARNING:   
OBEY THE FUEL SAFETY PROCEDURES.
Possible Causes

  • FLSCU 3 47QJ

  • PROBE-FQI NO 2, ACT2 66QT2

  • RELAY-CTL HI LVL, IND ACT 2 57QJ

  • aircraft wiring

  • VALVE-REFUEL, ACT 41QU

  • C/B-ACT1/CTL & SPLY 9QH

  • C/B-ACT1/REFUEL & SPLY 33QU

  • SWITCH-INDICATOR, ACT 24QH

  • SW-REFUEL VLV CTL, ACT 2 (42QU)

  • ACTUATOR-FUEL TRANSFER VALVE, ACT 6QH

  • VALVE-FUEL TRANSFER, ACT 165QM

  • RELAY-TRANSFER VALVE CONTROL, ACT 21QH

  • RELAY- INLET VALVE CONTROL, ACT1 19QH

  • RELAY-INLET VALVE CONTROL, ACT2 20QH

  • RELAY-SEQUENCE 18QH

  • RELAY-POWER SUPPLY SWITCH 39QU

  • ACTUATOR-FUEL INLET VALVE, ACT2 5QH2

  • VALVE-FUEL INLET, ACT2 166QM2

  • RELAY-REFUEL/TRANSFER CONTROL, ACT2 36QU

  • RELAY-REFUEL INHIBIT, ACT2 38QU

  • ACTUATOR-AIR SHUTOFF VALVE, ACT 3QH

  • RELAY-PRESSURIZATION CONTROL, ACT 28QH

  • ACTUATOR-VENT VALVE, ACT2 4QH2

  • VALVE-VENT, ACT2 167QM2

    • 1. Possible Causes
    •

    FLSCU 3 (47QJ)  

    •

    PROBE-FQI NO 2, ACT2 (66QT2)  

    •

    RELAY-CTL HI LVL, IND ACT 2 (57QJ)  

    •

    aircraft wiring 

    •

    VALVE-REFUEL, ACT (41QU)  

    •

    C/B-ACT1/CTL & SPLY (9QH)  

    •

    C/B-ACT1/REFUEL & SPLY (33QU)  

    •

    SWITCH-INDICATOR, ACT (24QH)  

    •

    SW-REFUEL VLV CTL, ACT 2 (42QU) 

    •

    ACTUATOR-FUEL TRANSFER VALVE, ACT (6QH)  

    •

    VALVE-FUEL TRANSFER, ACT (165QM)  

    •

    RELAY-TRANSFER VALVE CONTROL, ACT (21QH)  

    •

    RELAY- INLET VALVE CONTROL, ACT1 (19QH)  

    •

    RELAY-INLET VALVE CONTROL, ACT2 (20QH)  

    •

    RELAY-SEQUENCE (18QH)  

    •

    RELAY-POWER SUPPLY SWITCH (39QU)  

    •

    ACTUATOR-FUEL INLET VALVE, ACT2 (5QH2)  

    •

    VALVE-FUEL INLET, ACT2 (166QM2)  

    •

    RELAY-REFUEL/TRANSFER CONTROL, ACT2 (36QU)  

    •

    RELAY-REFUEL INHIBIT, ACT2 (38QU)  

    •

    ACTUATOR-AIR SHUTOFF VALVE, ACT (3QH)  

    •

    RELAY-PRESSURIZATION CONTROL, ACT (28QH)  

    •

    ACTUATOR-VENT VALVE, ACT2 (4QH2)  

    •

    VALVE-VENT, ACT2 (167QM2)  

    2. Job Set-up Information
    A. Fixtures, Tools, Test and Support Equipment

    REFERENCE

    QTY

    DESIGNATION

    No specific

    AR

    MULTIMETER - STANDARD

    B. Referenced Information

    REFERENCE

    DESIGNATION

    28-28-00-810-801-A

    Fuel Pumps - ACT Manual Transfer Pump 1QH System Malfunction

    28-28-00-810-801-A-01

    Fuel Pumps - ACT Manual Transfer Pump 1QH System Malfunction (802VU ACT Relay Testbox)

    28-28-00-810-802-A

    Fuel - ACT 1 Manual Transfer Failure (On The Ground)

    28-28-00-810-802-A-01

    Fuel - ACT 1 Manual Transfer Failure (On The Ground) (802VU ACT Relay Testbox)

    28-46-00-810-832-A

    ACT 2 HI LVL Indicator Lamp Does Not Come On When TEST Switch Set To LTS

    28-46-00-810-833-A

    ACT 2 HI LVL Manual TEST

    SEE AMM 12-11-28-650-004

    Pressure Refuel with Manual Control

    SEE AMM 12-11-28-650-005

    Pressure Refuel without Electrical Power

    SEE AMM 28-25-00-710-003

    Operational Test of the Refuel System

    SEE AMM 28-25-00-869-001

    Fuel Transfer

    SEE ASM 28-25-01

    		 

    SEE AMM 28-25-51-000-003

    Removal of the Solenoid Valve

    SEE AMM 28-25-51-000-004

    Removal of the Refuel Valve

    SEE AMM 28-25-51-400-003

    Installation of the Solenoid Valve

    SEE AMM 28-25-51-400-004

    Installation of the Refuel Valve

    SEE ASM 28-28-01

    		 

    SEE ASM 28-28-03

    		 

    SEE ASM 28-28-04

    		 

    SEE AMM 28-28-33-000-001

    Removal of the ACT Fuel Transfer-Valve

    SEE AMM 28-28-33-400-001

    Installation of the ACT Fuel Transfer-Valve

    SEE AMM 28-28-34-000-001

    Removal of the ACT Fuel Inlet Valve (166QM)

    SEE AMM 28-28-34-400-001

    Installation of the ACT Fuel Inlet Valve (166QM)

    SEE AMM 28-28-35-000-001

    Removal of the ACT Vent Shut-off Valve (167QM)

    SEE AMM 28-28-35-400-001

    Installation of the ACT Vent Shut-off Valve (167QM)

    SEE AMM 28-28-53-000-001

    Removal of the ACT Transfer-Valve Actuator

    SEE AMM 28-28-53-400-001

    Installation of the ACT Transfer-Valve Actuator

    SEE AMM 28-28-54-000-001

    Removal of the ACT Fuel Inlet Valve Actuator (5QH)

    SEE AMM 28-28-54-400-001

    Installation of the ACT Fuel Inlet Valve Actuator (5QH)

    SEE AMM 28-28-55-000-001

    Removal of the ACT Vent Shut-off Valve Actuator (4QH)

    SEE AMM 28-28-55-400-001

    Installation of the ACT Vent Shut-off Valve Actuator (4QH)

    SEE AMM 28-28-56-000-001

    Removal of the ACT Air Shut-Off Valve Actuator

    SEE AMM 28-28-56-400-001

    Installation of the ACT Air Shut-Off Valve Actuator

    SEE ASM 28-42-10

    		 

    SEE ASM 28-46-01

    		 
    3. Fault Confirmation

    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999

    SUBTASK 28-25-00-865-052 -A0 - (20170501)

    A. Table of the circuit breakers referred to in this procedure:
    PANEL DESIGNATION FIN CLIPPED LOCATION
    Effective on: 783-800 850-910 928-950 986-999
    121VU(elec)   ACT1/REFUEL & SPLY  33QU     L29 
    Effective on: 783-800 850-910 928-950 986-999
    121VU(elec)   ACT2/REFUEL & SPLY  34QU     L28 
    Effective on: 783-800 850-910 928-950 986-999
    121VU(elec)   ACT1/CTL & SPLY  9QH     P29 
    Effective on: 783-800 850-910 928-950 986-999
    121VU(elec)   ACT2/CTL & SPLY  10QH     P28 

    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999

    SUBTASK 28-25-00-710-063 -A0 - (20170501)

    B. Test
    (1) Make sure that you obey the steps in the Pressure Refuel with Manual Control SEE AMM 12-11-28-650-004 .
    NOTE:   
    It is not possible to refuel the ACT 2 if the P/BSW-FUEL/ACT/AUTO (24QH) is set to the FWD (pushed in), manual transfer position.
    NOTE:   
    The ACT 2 Inlet Valve Actuator (5QH2) will not open if the ACT 2 is full of fuel (high level sensor wet).
    (2) Do the Operational Test of the Refuel System SEE AMM 28-25-00-710-003 .
    NOTE:   
    You can get more data of the ACT System in the:
    •

    Description and Operation (D and O) section of the Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM) Chap, 28-25-00, the Refuel Defuel System

    •

    AMM Chap, 28-28-00, the Additional Center Tank (ACT) Transfer System

    •

    AMM Chap, 28-42-00, the Fuel Quantity Indicating System (FQIS)

    •

    AMM Chap, 28-46-00, the Fuel Level Sensing System (FLSS)

    •

    Aircraft Schematic Manual (ASM), Refuel/Defuel System Valve Control ACT 1 SEE ASM 28-25-01

    •

    ASM, ACT XFR System, Inlet Valve SEE ASM 28-28-01

    •

    ASM, ACT XFR System, Transfer Valve SEE ASM 28-28-03

    •

    ASM, ACT XFR System, Vent Valves SEE ASM 28-28-04

    •

    ASM, FQIS, Monitoring SEE ASM 28-42-10

    •

    ASM, FLSS, High Level Refuel Control SEE ASM 28-46-01 .


    4. Fault Isolation

    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999

    SUBTASK 28-25-00-810-063 -B0 - (20170501)

    A. Procedure
    (1) If the ACT 2 HI LVL Indicator Lamp does not come on when the TEST Switch is set to LTS (lights):
    •

    do ACT 2 HI LVL Indicator Lamp Failure
    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999 28-46-00-810-832-A .

    (2) If the ACT 2 HI LVL Indicator Lamp does not change condition when the TEST Switch is set to HI LVL or, does not go off when the TEST switch is released (because the ACT 2 is not full):
    •

    do ACT 2 HI LVL Manual TEST Failure
    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999 28-46-00-810-833-A to trouble-shoot the FLSCU 3 (47QJ)   and the PROBE-FQI NO 2, ACT2 (66QT2)   system.

    (3) If the fault continues, examine the ACT 2 fuel quantity on the FUEL System Display page.
    (a) If the ACT 2 fuel quantity shows less than 80 kg (180 lb) (low level sensors dry):
    •

    go to Step (7).

    (b) If the ACT 2 fuel quantity shows more than 80 kg (180 lb) (low level sensors wet):
    1 Make sure that the C/Bs that follow are closed:
    •

    C/B-ACT 2/XFR VLV/AUTO CTL (10QH)

    •

    C/B-ACT 2/REFUEL/VLV (34QU).

    NOTE:   
    This step is necessary to make sure that the ACT 2 system and RELAY-SEQUENCE (18QH) are energized.
    2 Do a Fuel Transfer from the ACT 2 to the center tank SEE AMM 28-25-00-869-001 .
    NOTE:   
    These steps have been included to check the ACT 2 Fuel Inlet Valve.

    A fuel transfer of the ACT 2 fuel will make sure there is correct operation of:

    •

    the inlet valve

    •

    the inlet valve actuator

    •

    the inlet valve actuator aircraft wiring, for the open command, between the actuator and the RELAY-PANEL 802VU.

    (4) If fuel can be transferred from or into the ACT 2:
    •

    go to Step (7).

    (5) If the fuel from the ACT 2 cannot be transferred forward:
    (a) Do the ACT Manual Transfer, Pump System Failure
    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999 28-28-00-810-801-A
    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999 28-28-00-810-801-A-01 .
    (b) Do the ACT Manual Transfer (On The Ground Failure)
    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999 28-28-00-810-802-A
    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999 28-28-00-810-802-A-01 .
    (6) Make sure that the C/Bs that follow are closed:
    •

    C/B-ACT 2/XFR VLV/AUTO CTL (10QH)

    •

    C/B-ACT 2/REFUEL/VLV (34QU).

    (7) Make sure that the refuel panel door 192MB/522KB/622KB is open.
    (8) Make sure that the SW-MODE SELECT/REFUEL/OFF/DEFUEL/XFR (3QU)) on the REFUEL/DEFUEL PANEL (800VU) is set to REFUEL.
    (9) Make sure that the SW-REFUEL VALVE/OPEN/NORM/SHUT ACT 2 (42QU) on the ACT REFUEL/DEFUEL PANEL (801VU) is set to OPEN.
    (10) With a MULTIMETER - STANDARD at the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) TEST connector 4068VC, do the four (4) tests that follow:
    (a) Do a check SEE ASM 28-25-01 to see if a ground is available at pin C.
    NOTE:   
    Relay-Panel 802VU Input

    A ground at pin C shows you that the ACT 2 has ullage (space) to receive fuel because the ACT 2 high level sensor is dry.

    1 If the ground is available at the TEST connector pin C, go to Step (b).
    2 If the ground is not available go to Step (11).
    (b) Do a check SEE ASM 28-25-01 to see if 28VDC is available between pin D and an applicable ground.
    NOTE:   
    Relay-Panel 802VU Input

    The 28VDC at pin D shows that the air shutoff valve actuator is closed and the ACT 2 vent valve actuator is open (their refuel positions).

    1 If the 28VDC is available at the TEST connector pin D, go to Step (c).
    2 If the 28VDC is not available go to Step (12).
    (c) Do a check SEE ASM 28-28-01 to see if 28VDC is available between pin P and an applicable ground.
    NOTE:   
    Relay-Panel 802VU Output

    The 28VDC at pin P is the open command to the actuator fuel inlet valve, ACT 2 (5QH2).

    1 If the 28VDC is available at the TEST connector pin P, go to Step (d).
    2 If the 28VDC is not available go to Step (15).
    (d) Do a check SEE ASM 28-25-01 to see if 28VDC is available between pin M and an applicable ground.
    NOTE:   
    Relay-Panel 802VU Output

    The 28VDC at pin M is the open command to the valve-refuel ACT (41QU).

    1 If the 28VDC is available go to Step (13).
    2 If the 28VDC is not available go to Step (14).
    (11) If a ground is not available at the TEST connector 4068VC, pin C, continue as follows:
    (a) Disconnect the free connector 4065VC-A from the RELAY-PANEL (802VU).
    (b) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-25-01 to see if a ground is available at the free connector 4065VC-A, pin T.
    (c) If the ground is not available:
    1 Do a check of the RELAY-CTL HI LVL, IND ACT 2 (57QJ)   and replace, if necessary.
    2 Do a check of the aircraft wiring  SEE ASM 28-25-01 and SEE ASM 28-46-01 between:
    •

    the FLSCU-3 (47QJ) rack connector AA, pin 8C and the free connector 4065VC-A, pin T (ACT 2 HI LVL (LS7) CHAN O/P)

    •

    the FLSCU-3 (47QJ) rack connector AA, pin 6C and the RELAY-CTL HI LVL, IND ACT 2 (57QJ), pin A

    •

    the RELAY-CTL HI LVL, IND ACT 2 (57QJ), pin 2 and the ground point DC1 (ground I/P for (LS7) CHAN RELAY O/P)

    •

    the RELAY-CTL HI LVL, IND ACT 2 (57QJ), pin Z and the ground point DC1 (relay control coil ground)

    •

    the RELAY-CTL HI LVL, IND ACT 2 (57QJ), pin X and the C/B-ACT2/REFUEL/VLV (34QU).

    (d) Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    (e) Connect the free connector 4065VC-A to the RELAY-PANEL (802VU).
    (f) Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (g) If the fault continues, do ACT 2 HI LVL Manual TEST Failure
    Effective on: 783-800, 850-910, 928-950, 986-999 28-46-00-810-833-A .
    (12) If 28VDC is not available at the TEST connector 4068VC, pin D, continue as follows:
    (a) Disconnect the free connector 4065VC-A, from the RELAY-PANEL (802VU).
    (b) Do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-25-01 between:
    •

    the free connector 4065VC-A, pin L and the aircraft to tank interface 7619VC2, pin 21

    •

    the ACT 2 aircraft to tank interface free connector 7619VC2-A, pin 21 and the Actuator-Vent Valve, ACT 2 free connector 4QH2-A, pin C.

    (c) Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    (d) Connect the free connector 4065VC-A, to the RELAY-PANEL (802VU).
    (e) Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (f) If the fault continues:
    •

    go to Step (15).

    (13) If 28VDC is available at the TEST connector 4068VC, pin M, continue as follows:
    (a) Get access to the Valve-Refuel, ACT (41QU).
    (b) Disconnect the free connector 41QU-A from the VALVE-REFUEL, ACT (41QU).
    (c) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-25-01 to see if 28VDC is available at the free connector 41QU-A, between the pins A (+ve) and C (-ve).
    NOTE:   
    The ground at pin C is only available if the Actuator Fuel XFR Valve (6QH) is in the closed position.
    (d) If the:
    1 28VDC (pin A) and the ground (pin C) are available at the free connector 41QU-A, in Step (13)(c):
    a Do a check and replace if necessary the VALVE-REFUEL, ACT (41QU)   SEE AMM 28-25-51-000-003 and SEE AMM 28-25-51-400-003 .
    NOTE:   
    The resistance of the solenoid and internally connected diode is as follows:

    With the multimeter +ve lead connected to pin A and the -ve lead connected to pin C, make sure the resistance is between 200 and 300 ohms.

    With the multimeter +ve lead connected to pin C and the -ve lead connected to pin A, make sure the resistance is between 20 and 30 ohms.

    b If the fault continues,
    •

    do a Pressure Refuel of the ACT without Electrical Power to check the VALVE-REFUEL, ACT (41QU) SEE AMM 12-11-28-650-005 .

    c If necessary, replace the VALVE-REFUEL, ACT (41QU)   SEE AMM 28-25-51-000-004 and SEE AMM 28-25-51-400-004 .
    2 28VDC is not available at the free connector 41QU-A, pin A in Step (13)(c):
    a Do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-25-01 between:
    •

    the free connector 41QU-A, pin A and the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) free connector 4065VC-A, pin <J.

    b Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    c Connect the free connector 41QU-A to the VALVE-REFUEL, ACT (41QU).
    d Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    e If the fault continues, go to Step (20).
    3 A ground is not available at the free connector 41QU-A, pin C in Step (13)(c)
    a Do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-25-01 between:
    •

    the free connector 41QU-A, pin C and the Actuator Fuel XFR Valve free connector 6QH-A, pin B.

    b Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    c Connect the free connector 41QU-A to the VALVE-REFUEL, ACT (41QU).
    d Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    e If the fault continues, go to Step (15).
    (14) If 28VDC is not available at the TEST connector 4068VC, pin M, continue as follows:
    (a) Disconnect the free connector 4065VC-A, from the RELAY-PANEL (802VU).
    (b) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-25-01 to see if 28VDC is available between free connector 4065VC-A:
    •

    pin <G (+ve) and pin <T or <M (-ve) (normal supply)

    •

    pin <S (+ve) and pin <T or <M (-ve) (refuel supply).

    1 If the 28VDC is available:
    •

    go to Step (14)(c).

    2 If the 28VDC is not available:
    a Do a check of and replace, if necessary:
    •

    the C/B-ACT1/CTL & SPLY (9QH)  

    •

    the C/B-ACT1/REFUEL & SPLY (33QU)   .

    b Do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-25-01 between:
    •

    the C/B-ACT1/XFR VALVE/AUTO CTL (9QH), terminal 2 and the free connector 4065VC-A, pin <G

    •

    the C/B-ACT1/REFUEL/VLV (33QU), terminal 2 and the free connector 4065VC-A, pin <S.

    c Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    d Connect the free connector 4065VC-A to the RELAY-PANEL (802VU).
    e Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (c) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-25-01 to see if a ground is available at the free connector 4065VC-A, pin <N.
    1 If a ground is available:
    •

    go to Step (14)(d).

    2 If a ground is not available:
    a Do a check of SEE ASM 28-25-01 and replace if necessary:
    •

    the SWITCH-INDICATOR, ACT (24QH)   .

    b Do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-25-01 between:
    •

    the P/BSW-FUEL/ACT/AUTO (24QH), terminal A2 and the free connector 4065VC-A, pin <N.

    c Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    d Connect the free connector 4065VC-A to the RELAY-PANEL (802VU).
    e Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (d) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-25-01 to see if 28VDC is available at the free connector 4065VC-A, between pin S and an applicable ground.
    1 If the 28VDC is available:
    •

    go to Step (15).

    2 If the 28VDC is not available:
    a Do a check of SEE ASM 28-25-01 and replace, if necessary:
    •

    the SW-REFUEL VLV CTL, ACT 2 (42QU)  , part of the REFUEL/DEFUEL PANEL (801VU).

    b Do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-25-01 between:
    •

    the free connector 4065VC-A, pin S and the free connector 4067VC-A, pin K

    •

    the free connector 4067VC-A, pin D and the free connector 4023VC-A, pin <G.

    c Repair all the serviceable wiring and connectors.
    d Connect the free connector 4065VC-A to the RELAY-PANEL (802VU).
    e Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (15) If the fault continues (when you think all the inputs to the relay-panel are correct):
    (a) Examine the see/feel indicators of the actuators shown in the table that follows:
    (b) If one of the actuators is not in the position given in the table:
    •

    go to the Fault Isolation Step indicated in the right (end) column.

    ACTUATOR FUNCTIONAL DESIGNATION

    FIN

    CORRECT REFUEL POSITION

    IF ACTUATOR NOT AT THE CORRECT REFUEL POSITION, GO TO THE TROUBLE-SHOOTING STEP SHOWN BELOW

    FUEL XFR VALVE

    6QH

    CLOSED

    (16)

    FUEL INLET VALVE, ACT 2

    5QH2

    OPEN

    (17)

    AIR SHUT OFF VALVE

    3QH

    CLOSED

    (18) SEE NOTE

    VENT VALVE, ACT 2

    4QH2

    OPEN

    (19)

    NOTE:   
    The Actuator Air Shutoff Valve (3QH), 28VDC command to CLOSE, can also be checked at the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) TEST connector 4068VC, pin Z.
    (16) Actuator Fuel Transfer Valve (6QH) Refuel Trouble-shooting
    (a) Disconnect the free connector 6QH-A from the ACTUATOR-FUEL XFR VALVE, ACT (6QH).
    (b) Make sure the P/BSW-FUEL/ACT/AUTO (24QH) is set to AUTO (released out).
    (c) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-28-03 to see if 28VDC is available at the free connector 6QH-A, between pins C (+ve), and E (-ve).
    (d) If the voltage is correct, do a check of and replace, if necessary:
    1 The ACTUATOR-FUEL TRANSFER VALVE, ACT (6QH)   SEE AMM 28-28-53-000-001 and SEE AMM 28-28-53-400-001 .
    2 The VALVE-FUEL TRANSFER, ACT (165QM)   SEE AMM 28-28-33-000-001 and SEE AMM 28-28-33-400-001 .
    (e) If the voltage is not correct, do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-28-03 between:
    •

    the Actuator Fuel XFR Valve free connector 6QH-A, pin C and the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) free connector 4065VC-A, pin <P

    •

    the Actuator Fuel XFR Valve free connector 6QH-A, pin E and the ground point DC1.

    (f) Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    (g) Connect the free connector 6QH-A to the ACTUATOR-FUEL XFR VALVE, ACT (6QH).
    (h) Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (i) If the fault continues:
    1 Do a check of SEE ASM 28-28-03 and replace, if necessary:
    •

    the RELAY-TRANSFER VALVE CONTROL, ACT (21QH)  

    •

    the RELAY- INLET VALVE CONTROL, ACT1 (19QH)  

    •

    the RELAY-INLET VALVE CONTROL, ACT2 (20QH)  

    •

    the RELAY-SEQUENCE (18QH)  

    •

    the RELAY-POWER SUPPLY SWITCH (39QU)   .

    2 Do a check of the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) wiring SEE ASM 28-28-03 between the connector to relay and relay to relay lines, as shown in the table that follows:
    NOTE:   
    The circuit connections shown in the table are abbreviated, for example:
    •

    the connector 4065VC, pin <P is shown as 4065VC-<P

    •

    the RELAY-XFR VALVE CTL, ACT (21QH), terminal B3 is shown as RL 21QH-B3.

    CONNECTOR-PIN

    RELAY-TERMINAL TO

    RELAY-TERMINAL

    CONNECTOR-PIN

    4065VC-<P

    		 

    RL 21QH-B3

    		 
     

    RL 21QH-B2

    RL 19QH-A3

    		 
     

    RL 19QH-A2

    RL 18QH-A3

    		 
     

    RL 21QH-B2

    3 Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    4 Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (17) Actuator Fuel Inlet Valve (5QH2) Refuel Trouble-shooting
    (a) Disconnect the free connector 5QH2-A from the ACTUATOR-FUEL INLET VALVE, ACT 2 (5QH2).
    (b) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-28-01 to see if 28VDC is available at the free connector 5QH2-A, between pins A (+ve) and E (-ve).
    (c) If the voltage is correct, do a check of and replace, if necessary:
    1 The ACTUATOR-FUEL INLET VALVE, ACT2 (5QH2)   SEE AMM 28-28-54-000-001 and SEE AMM 28-28-54-400-001 .
    2 The VALVE-FUEL INLET, ACT2 (166QM2)   SEE AMM 28-28-34-000-001 and SEE AMM 28-28-34-400-001 .
    (d) If the voltage is not correct, do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-28-01 between:
    •

    the free connector 5QH2-A, pin A and the aircraft to tank break free connector 7619VC2-A, pin 15

    •

    the free connector 5QH2-A, pin E and the aircraft to tank break free connector 7619VC2-A, pin 5

    •

    the aircraft to tank break connector 7619VC2, pin 15 and the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) free connector 4065VC-A, pin G

    •

    the aircraft to tank break connector 7619VC2, pin 5 and the ground point DC1.

    (e) Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    (f) Connect the free connector 5QH2-A to the ACTUATOR-FUEL INLET VALVE, ACT 2 (5QH2).
    (g) Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (h) If the fault continues:
    1 Do a check of SEE ASM 28-28-01 , SEE ASM 28-28-03 and replace, if necessary:
    •

    the RELAY-INLET VALVE CONTROL, ACT2 (20QH)  

    •

    the RELAY-REFUEL/TRANSFER CONTROL, ACT2 (36QU)  

    •

    the RELAY-REFUEL INHIBIT, ACT2 (38QU)  

    •

    RELAY-POWER SUPPLY SWITCH (39QU)   .

    2 Do a check of the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) wiring SEE ASM 28-28-01 and SEE ASM 28-28-03 between the connector to relay and relay to relay lines, as shown in the table that follows:
    NOTE:   
    The circuit connections shown in the table are abbreviated, for example:
    •

    the connector 4065VC, pin G is shown as 4065VC-G

    •

    the RELAY-INLET VALVE CTL, ACT 2 (20QH), terminal B3 is shown as RL 20QH-B3.

    (18) Actuator Air Shut Off Valve (3QH), Refuel Trouble-shooting
    (a) Disconnect the free connector 3QH-A from the ACTUATOR-AIR SHUTOFF VALVE, ACT (3QH).
    (b) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-28-04 to see if 28VDC is available at the free connector 3QH-A, between pins B (+ve), and E (-ve).
    (c) If the voltage is correct, do a check of and replace, if necessary:
    •

    the ACTUATOR-AIR SHUTOFF VALVE, ACT (3QH)   SEE AMM 28-28-56-000-001 and SEE AMM 28-28-56-400-001 .

    (d) If the voltage is not correct, do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-28-04 between:
    •

    the Actuator Air Shutoff Valve free connector 3QH-A, pin B and the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) free connector 4065VC-A, pin <R

    •

    the Actuator Air Shutoff Valve free connector 3QH-A, pin E and the ground point DC1.

    (e) Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    (f) Connect the free connector 3QH-A to the ACTUATOR-AIR SHUTOFF VALVE, ACT (3QH).
    (g) Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (h) If the fault continues:
    1 Do a check of SEE ASM 28-28-04 and replace, if necessary:
    •

    the RELAY-PRESSURIZATION CONTROL, ACT (28QH)   .

    2 Do a check of the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) wiring SEE ASM 28-28-04 between the connector to relay and relay to relay lines, as shown in the table that follows:
    NOTE:   
    The circuit connections shown in the table are abbreviated, for example:
    •

    the connector 4065VC, pin <R is shown as 4065VC-<R

    •

    the RELAY-PRESS CTL, ACT (28QH), terminal A1 is shown as RL 28QH-A1.

    (19) Actuator Vent Valve (4QH2), Refuel Trouble-shooting
    (a) Disconnect the free connector 4QH2-A from the ACTUATOR-VENT VALVE, ACT 2 (4QH2).
    (b) With a multimeter do a check SEE ASM 28-28-04 to see if 28VDC is available at the free connector 4QH2-A, between pins A (+ve) and E (-ve).
    (c) If the voltage is correct, do a check of and replace, if necessary:
    1 The ACTUATOR-VENT VALVE, ACT2 (4QH2)   SEE AMM 28-28-55-000-001 and SEE AMM 28-28-55-400-001 .
    2 The VALVE-VENT, ACT2 (167QM2)   SEE AMM 28-28-35-000-001 and SEE AMM 28-28-35-400-001 .
    (d) If the voltage is not correct:
    1 Do a check of the aircraft wiring SEE ASM 28-28-04 between:
    •

    the free connector 4QH2-A, pin A and the aircraft to tank break free connector 7619VC2-A, pin 20

    •

    the free connector 4QH2-A, pin E and the aircraft to tank break free connector 7619VC2-A, pin 8

    •

    the aircraft to tank break connector 7619VC2, pin 20 and the ACTUATOR-AIR SHUT-OFF VALVE, ACT free connector 3QH-A, pin D

    •

    the aircraft to tank break connector 7619VC2, pin 8 and the ground point DC1.

    (e) Repair all the unserviceable wiring and connectors.
    (f) Connect the free connector 4QH2-A to the ACTUATOR-VENT VALVE, ACT 2 (4QH2).
    (g) Do the test given in Para. 3.B.(2).
    (h) If the fault continues, do a check of and replace, if necessary:
    •

    the ACTUATOR-AIR SHUTOFF VALVE, ACT (3QH)   SEE AMM 28-28-56-000-001 and SEE AMM 28-28-56-400-001 .

    NOTE:   
    This step is necessary because the control voltage for the Actuator Vent Valve 4QH2 comes from the Actuator Air Shutoff Valve 3QH only when it is completely closed.

    No RELAY-PANEL (802VU) Internal Trouble-shooting is therefore required.

    (20) Continued from Step (13)(d)2_e_
    (a) Do a check of SEE ASM 28-25-01 , SEE ASM 28-28-03 and replace, if necessary:
    •

    the RELAY-REFUEL/TRANSFER CONTROL, ACT2 (36QU)  

    •

    the RELAY-POWER SUPPLY SWITCH (39QU)   .

    (b) Do a check of the RELAY-PANEL (802VU) wiring SEE ASM 28-25-01 and SEE ASM 28-28-03 between the connector to relay and relay to relay lines, as shown in the table that follows:
    NOTE:   
    The circuit connections shown in the table are abbreviated, for example:
    •

    the connector 4065VC, pin <J is shown as 4065VC-<J

    •

    the RELAY-REFUEL/XFR CTL, ACT 2 (36QU), terminal D1 is shown as RL 36QU-D1.

title: Task 28-25-00-810-814-A Refuel (Act 2) - Fails To Refuel In Manual Control
